name: Saddle Joint
description: The Saddle Joint is a woodworking joint where one piece of wood has a concave shape cut into it that allows it to fit over a perpendicular or crossing piece, resembling a saddle over a horse. This joint is commonly used in furniture making, particularly in components that require a strong connection across varying planes.
operations: Cutting a concave notch into the receiving piece
Shaping the connecting piece to fit into the notch
Finishing to ensure smooth fit and clean appearance
